title: American_Top_40_1973_January_20th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This rebroadcast is one of many I have recorded from internet radio. A few are incomplete but most are not and I hope you enjoy these as much as I do.

In this broadcast:

John Fogarty is singing with one of these acts but it isn't Creedence Clearwater Revival.

Casey answers the question, "Which act had the most top 40 hits in 1972?"

This is the only countdown where Casey gives the wrong chart position and then corrects himself Ã¢â‚¬Å“At number seven - oh, number six for this weekÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½

At number 24 is Albert Hammond. Casey tells how his records used to outsell Elvis's.

Casey answers the question, "Which recording act for Motown was the first to hit number one?"

Casey also answers the question, "Which day of the week has appeared in the most song titles?"

Then a listener answers his own question, "What top ten recording that was first released on an album took the longest time to be later released as a single?"
